title: Simulation-Based Learning for Exploring the Relationship Between Design Decisions and Performance

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific principles, experience in designing simple experiments
context.additional_context: A course where learners visually explore the relationship between design variables and performance outcomes through virtual experiments in a VR environment.

learning_goals: Students can measure the impact of changing at least three design variables (e.g., structural height, material strength) on performance metrics (stability, efficiency) using VR simulations
Students can visually represent and explain the balance between conflicting performance metrics by applying the concept of Pareto optimization
Students can derive optimized design solutions at least twice by mapping the design decision space to the performance outcome space
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
